headline: Grilled Filet Mignon with Gorgonzola Cream Sauce
description: Tender filet mignon steak is drizzled with a savory Gorgonzola cream sauce and topped with crumbled bacon bits and sliced green onions.
name: Grilled Filet Mignon with Gorgonzola Cream Sauce
recipeIngredient: 0.25 teaspoon lemon pepper, or to taste
0.25 teaspoon garlic powder, or to taste
0.25 teaspoon onion powder, or to taste
salt and ground black pepper to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Make sauce: Pour heavy cream into a saucepan and bring to a boil over medium heat. Reduce heat and simmer until cream is reduced by half, stirring occasionally, about 1 hour. Remove from heat; whisk in Gorgonzola cheese, Parmesan cheese, salt, pepper, and nutmeg until cheeses have melted. Cover to keep warm and set aside.
Prepare steaks: Season beef with lemon pepper, garlic powder, onion powder, salt, and pepper; set aside to marinate.
Meanwhile, place bacon in a large, deep skillet over medium-high heat. Cook, stirring occasionally, until evenly browned, about 10 minutes. Drain bacon on a paper towel-lined plate.
Preheat an outdoor grill for medium-high heat. Lightly grease the grate with cooking spray.

Cook steaks on the preheated grill until they begin to firm up and are reddish-pink and juicy in the center, 3 to 5 minutes per side. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read 130 degrees F (54 degrees C) for medium-rare. Transfer steaks to a plate; tent with foil to rest for 5 to 10 minutes.
Serve steaks with Gorgonzola sauce and top with bacon and green onion.

review.reviewBody: Wow-good!! And would work on any cut of beef - including the cheaper cuts! I had sirloin and had to halve the recipe since it was just the two of us. Started step 2 at noon (seasoning the steaks) and returned to the fridge until an hour before we were going to start the grill (to bring steaks to room temperature) - so, roughly 5 hour marinate time. Sauce; I also halved (2c vs 4) but left the two cheese amounts as written and did 1/8 tsp nutmeg, salt and pepper. Even halved, the sauce almost took an hour to cook down (I did use a smaller burner) and STILL have leftover sauce! I am debating whether to use over chicken or burgers. This truly was amazing and even my “likes only S&P on his steaks” husband really, really enjoyed this! PS; also great with sautéd mushrooms. Thank you Shawn Alton!!

This is the most amazing steak I have ever had. I have been to many 5 star restaurants and my family all had the same comment. Tonight I made this for the third time since December and I can't wait to make it again! I couldn't recommend this any higher. I wish I could give it 10 stars!
Scott made this it's really good
Just made the sauce and it was great. Best topping for a steak yet. Will definitely make it again. It also works well on pork chops.
Will definitely make again!
Love love love !

Using food available in the fridge I substituted blue cheese and grilled rib eye steak. I did not have any bacon. Oh well. 

I had lots of cream sauce leftover so we grilled steaks again a few days later. 

Tasted great.
My spouse who is a very good cook tried this recipe. The cream did not reduce. We had a liquid mess on our hands. Very disappointing.
The sauce was amazing! My whole family loved it, including grandkids. Will definitely make it again
Made it with mashed potatoes and garlic string beans. It was a perfect meal. I might consider throwing some butter in the pan with the steak and vegetable oil next time.
Not something we can make often but an excellent defendant treat.

I used this recipe for the cream sauce itself (my husband grills the steaks :) and it was delicious, but I used half of the cream, 5 oz. of the cheese, and the same amount of the rest of the ingredients as I wanted a thicker sauce. It was delicious and turned out exactly as I wanted. I thought the nutmeg was an unusual addition, but it gave it a really nice flavor. Even though I halved the amount of cream, I still had quite a bit left over, so I steamed some broccoli, cauliflower, and carrots and mixed it in with them, and that worked well too. The sauce is delicious and versatile, and I would definitely like to make it again.
By far the best meal I have ever had!!!!!!!! The flavor for deft 5/5
excellent
excellent
Delicious!! Made it for Christmas Eve and will definitely continue to make, even my little ones enjoyed.
Absolutely loved it. my kids constantly ask me to make it for their birthdays.

The sauce did take longer than the recipe said in order to reduce by half. When I made it with my filets, I liked it. I came here to say that when I had the leftover sauce with chicken, I liked it even better! Made the full recipe of sauce if not more, because you can eat it on anything! Well, any meat at least.
Delicious!
It was delicious. Couldn't find Gorgonzola cheese in my area so I used Brie cheese. It was amazing. Would love to try it with Gorgonzola cheese.
Amazing!!
Wow! This was amazing. My husband and I made it for Valentines dinner. We grilled some asparagus & drizzled the sauce on that, too. It was so good.

Made this sauce last night for my wife for Valentines day. But instead of using Gorgonzola, I used Smoked Gouda!! I'm sure the Gorgonzola is good but the smoked flavor of the Gouda along with the lemon asparagus was perfect. My wife sopped up the sauce. Very good!
Used three cups heavy cream and more Gorgonzola. No nutmeg. So delicious , really didn't need to bother with the bacon and scallions.
The Gorgonzola sauce is incredible, one of the best things I've ever tasted.
This sauce (with the addition of nutmeg) is Ina Garten's recipe and it is absolutely delicious! It's wonderful on beef and would probably be great on asparagus or green beans, too.

Observations:

Despite following the recipe exactly, sauce was consistency of milk when pouring over steaks. I didn't wash my pans after dinner--don't judge ;-)--and, next morning, the remaining sauce in the pot was thickened and what I would consider the correct consistency. So, IF I made this again, I'd allow time after cooking for it to sit and, hopefully thicken.

Speaking of there being remaining sauce--this recipe makes A LOT of sauce. I served a family of 5 and still had LOTS left over. I'd probably half it next time.

I've seen other commenters mention it and so did my (adult) son: it's bland. I'd add some spices to increase flavor. Or, as my son suggested, try it again using bleu cheese instead of Gorgonzola.
It was restaurant quality! Next time, I'll decrease the amount of cream by half; just too much sauce left over! Otherwise I'll be making it again!
I made mine in a cast iron skillet for Valentine's Day and I came...so did my husband. It was so good and so filling we decided to sleep for the rest of the evening.

Recipe was really good. I made this for a small New Year's Eve get together. We all used the sauced sparingly so it wouldn't overburden the steak. If you do the same, prepare for a lot of leftover sauce. As a side recommendation, the leftover sauce goes well in an omelet with any leftover bacon and chives you may have left over as well.

This is a wonderful recipe, although I used ribeyes in lieu of the filets. The cream sauce is very good, but I believe that it could easily be cut in half, as we had quite a bit leftover. This is a definite keeper in our house. Thanks for the recipe!
Add fresh horseradish to sauce recipe (to taste)

Awesome!!! Made tonight, and the only thing I forgot was the green onion....didn't need it. Bacon I used was ready made kind and just crumbled ontop. The filets we made inside (storms) so we preheated the gas oven to 425 and baked 9 minutes each side, and they came out medium rare which is what we were aiming for, too rare and hubby gets grossed out. Sauce I made in a medium stainless steel sauce pan with a copper bottom and it only took 40-45 minutes to reduce once I got to the right temp. And as another reviewer noted this is a "to taste"sauce and you either add or reduce the cheeses and salt/pepper to your liking, but the nutmeg makes it so don't omit it, taste the sauce while adding the ingredients. Made with farro and asparagus, the sauce was great on the asparagus.
I used this recipe for an anniversary dinner. The girlfriend claimed it was the best meal I've made to date. Highly recommend.

Very yummy! I love recipes that involve the grill.
Like an idiot, I stopped watching the cream and it boiled over. It didn't thicken up like I thought it would, but if I let things boil over, I guess I am not that great of a cook. I would make again!
Simply delicious. I did not think I would like it because of the type of cheese, I was totally wrong. Followed the recipe exactly. yum.
Sooooo good

I made this recipe for our contest in school! It was awesome! I am a culinary student and our head chefs loved the dish! The texture of the sauce and flavor was perfect. The fillet mignon was so great(setting in foil really worked) it was medium cooked. I was so happy that the chefs loved it! It was an achievement..Thank you Shawnalton and allrecipes.

OMG! I can't even begin to explain how amazing this was. This is a restaurant quality dish and it's suitable for a low carb diet! Compliments to the chef who created this as I will be using this to impress house from this day forward!

I made this for my husband and I. The sauce was delicious! It didn't take quite as long for the heavy cream to reduce, but I kept my eye on it so it wouldn't burn. I'm looking forward to making this for guests one day soon.
My husband said that he's going to dream about the cream sauce tonight!

My sauce didn't turn out well because I used a cream starter instead. By the time hubby got the steaks off the grill it was as thick as paste. Both hub by and grandson said it tasted good but I was underwhelmed. Next time use nonfat half and half and thicken if necessary. Also I think I prefer the flavor of blue cheese instead of Gorgonzola to compliment the rich steaks. Maybe next time I'll just use crumbled blue cheese on the steaks or hamburger just before it comes off the grill. Less calories and a complimentary flavor with beef. Or combine blue cheese with Panko and put under the broiler for a minute or two.

Absolutely delectable!! I got the filet mignon steaks from the Fresh Market, and the quantity of the steak was Un-Real. The sauce? AMAZING! The Gorgonzola cheese mixed with the parmesan was so gooood! Served with steamed asparagus, baked potatoes & French bread.

I followed directions exactly as written and couldn't have been happier. I'm all about flavor and this recipe is full of flavor. How could you go wrong, bacon, thick cream with cheese flavor with onions. The wife loved this and so did I. I will make this again and will try with chicken breasts as well. Thanks for the recipe. This was really outstanding for me to rate 5 stars.
Great recipe! Sauce has a great flavor! My husband couldn't stop talking about how good the cheese was!
I made just the sauce and poured over bacon wrapped filet mignon and grilled asparagus; it was a huge hit. My family loved it! Will definitely make again!

My boyfriend is a big gorgonzola fan and I decided to make this one night for dinner. I actually used a little more gorgonzola than the recipe called for and we were not disappointed. I will be making this recipe in the future.
So delicious!! Used a New York strip. Doesn't overwhelm taste buds but pushing them to the limit of satisfactory! Didn't add the nutmeg but so good thanks for the recipe.

I don't have a nice outdoor grill, so I cook the steaks in the broiler for only 2-3 minutes per side. The cream didn't turn out that well for me (hence the three stars); it was still runny after an hour of simmering. In retrospect, I would use only three cups of cream and add cornstarch to speed up the thickening process.

OK, so I changed the recipe. so shoot me for rating it 5 stars but I can't help it. with the few small changes that I made this was AMAZING! As another reviewer suggested I used only 1 cup cream with the full amounts of everything else. I did add a pinch of cayenne but couldn't even taste it anyways. the only slight problem I had was that the sauce did not thicken even with the reduced amt of cream. Ended up adding probably a bit more than a T cornstarch. Perfect. Nice and thick, good flavour, especially with the bacon and green onions. for my steaks I wrapped them in bacon and broiled them after brushing with some olive oil, salt and pepper. To die for!

I made this for Valentines day and it was delicious! I followed the recipe exactly as far as ingredients but I did use less cream to make a smaller quantity of the sauce (there were only 2 of us). I just eyeballed the Gorgonzola & Parmesan according to my taste and just added until i got the consistency I wanted (and it didn't take a full hour to get the cream to reduce/thicken nicely- I only used about 1.5 cups and we had plenty of sauce for 2 people to use generously). It's very flavorful & rich- definitely my favorite cream sauce I've ever eaten on a steak! I wasn't sure about the nutmeg- I like it but my husband doesn't - however I went for it & we didn't notice it in the finished product. However, the sauce was so good, I will make it exactly the same next time as I can only assume it's in there for a reason! I also seasoned the steaks according to this recipe and would follow this again- I did them stove top in my grilling pan. I paired this with roasted asparagus and the whole meal was a success. Great recipe for a special occasion at home- yet, it wasn't difficult, only took me about 40min start to finish so it was feasible for a working mom with a toddler to pull off with little hassle. *we don't care much for onions, so I garnished the top with the bacon crumbles & a little fresh parsley which added color and also seemed to work nicely with the cream sauce. Can't wait to make this again!

I made this for New Year's Eve dinner and it was fabulous! The only changes I made was to the sauce- I used half n half and reduced fat gorgonzola simply because that is what I had on hand. The sauce does take one hour - and needs 'hand holding' so plan to spend the time. And, don't forget the nutmeg- it's a must. This is a 5 star dish suitable for a special occasion.

This is delicious!!!! It took just over an hour and we ate it in minutes it was so good! Love the sauce! We had some fresh New Jersey corn and asparagus on the side and the flavors came together nicely. Certainly not an inexpensive meal but well worth it!

My dad and I made this for Christmas dinner. The sauce was a pain in the , but MAN was it good. The only people in the family who aren't demanding it every year are the people who generally do the cooking and were humbled by the deliciousness. Not difficult, and the leftovers made by far the best mac'n'cheese I've ever had. Unfortunately, regular steak and mac'n'cheese are ruined for me now.
Love this sauce!
I made for my boyfriend on Valentines Day and he loved it, I used NY strips, because they were sold out of tenderloins, but it was still soOoOoOoo good : )
Great! Sauce is heavenly! Will be great on pasta.

This sauce was awesome - it did take some time to reduce down, but well worth it. The gorgonzola was not overpowering but rich and delicious. We enjoyed the sauce on the sides we prepared as well - asparagus & baked potato. It was a wonderful Valentines Meal - at a fraction of the restaurant cost.

This sauce was amazing! We were practically drinking it. Even my 16 yr old daughter loved it. I followed the recipe exactly except I used blue cheese instead of the milder Gorgonzola. Easy to make too- so try it!
Absolutely amazing recipe! I'd serve this meal to the President...
4.5 stars
4.5 stars

My daughter, who is NOT a cook, surprised me with this for my birthday dinner. When I heard what she had made I was prepared to order pizza but instead was blown away! It was incredible! As another reviewer said, the sauce is amazing would be excellent on many other things. Thanks for sharing a recipe that made a novice look like a pro! It has become my requested birthday dinner now.
I made this recipe for my husband's birthday. It was so good. Yes, it is rich but so good..It would also taste good on pasta. Thanks for sharing your recipe.
i love it. will make again
Oh my!!! This was amazing. I made it for my family for a special Sunday dinner...I can't wait to plan my next dinner with friends - this will definitely be on the menu!

Best recipe I've made in years!! I could put this sauce over cereal, it's that good! I will be making this one again and again.

One tip...do not add cheese and spices to reduced cream until the steak is done and resting.
I have just done the sauce and it was excellent.
Fixed the Gorgonzola Cream Sauce with Delmonico Steaks. The Cream Sauce was Great

INCREDIBLE SAUCE--MUST TRY!! This sauce is so yummy & even my picky husband loved and requests every time we have filet steaks. I have even made the sauce to drizzle over chicken and it was amazing!! This was really easy to make and I feel like its impossible to mess it up...comes out perfect every time. Thanks for sharing!
love this sauce
I made this for my fiancé and I and he absolutely loved it. Great Recipe.

Incredible! Followed recipe exactly except added 1Tbls. Cajun seasoning to the sauce for a little flavor. Only complaint, grilling steaks to 130 degrees, then tenting for 8 minutes brought them to medium well (we used thick fillets). Next time, will cook less.
Delicious! The cream sauce is easy and yummy on lots of things. I make it and put it over asparagus.
I'm rating just the cream sauce but I'd give it 5000 stars if I could. It is absolutely awesome. Not health food but who cares once in a while! Thanks!
Delicious and beautiful - a truly gourmet grilling experience!
simply put, The best steak I've ever had! Cant wait to make this again.
I use flank steak instead of filet. Slice thin on a plate, drizzle with cream sauce, sprinkle with onion and bacon. Makes a beautiful presentation and tastes fabulous!

I made the recipe as is. The key to the sauce is using a wide-bottomed pan....more surface area for the heavy cream to evaporate. I started with a smaller pan and it was taking forever (like other reviews said). As soon as I switched to a large pan it reduced by half quickly!
Make sure you really like gorgonzola cheese before you make it. The sauce was very strong. I only used about 1/4 of the sauce on our fillets and it was plenty!
I made this the other night. This recipe is devine!! If your looking for another way to spice up your fillet mignon...this is it!!

Amazing. FABULOUS. Better than any steak I've ever had in my life. Everything is there... the different array of flavors, the different textures, the exquisite sauce. I don't think I'd do anything different.

Do NOT do heaping scoops of the cheese though. Follow the recipe to the smidgeon, otherwise it's imbalanced.
Absolutely amazing forgot the greenonions but was great non the same

Do not, I repeat, do not try to substitute fat free half and half in this recipe. I will try it again one of these days with heavy cream. The only reason I gave this two stars is because it's my own darn fault!
Awesome!
as ordered ! It was great you could use this on a Burger Works for me !
This was the first time I have ever made something like this. My wife had the filet and I had a Ribeye. I used the Gorgonzola sauce for both of them and it was amazing.
Sauce
FABULOUS!!! I hardly ever cook steak because I'm not very good at it. The steak was delicious and tender. The cream sauce was absolutely decadent. Great dish for company.

This sauce is really good and a nice way to dress up steak. It makes a lot and is very rich so I'll probably try cutting the recipe in half next time. I wasn't paying attention and the cream boiled over so keep an eye on that! I also added Cajun seasoning as I thought the sauce was a bit bland without it. Have made several times and really enjoyed it, thanks for the recipe!
Unhealthy as heck but tastes great
A MAZ ING!

This sauce is delicious. You just have to use it immediately because if you let it sit, it starts to thicken up pretty quickly. I used this on filet mignon with mushrooms and my husband loved it commenting, "Wow, what I do to deserve this special meal?" I will be making again, but will probably try on other cuts of steak and chicken too.
This was FANTASTIC. Won't be making it too often because of how expensive Filet Mignon is, but it was great for an anniversary dinner. Will DEFINITELY make again! Thanks!!
Very, very good. A for sure crowd pleaser. I added more cheese to thicken up the sauce.

I followed this recipe EXACTLY (for 2 servings) and it absolutely delicious. My boyfriend told me this dish was "restaurant" quality. I served this with grilled asparagus and that was plenty. The Gorgonzola cream sauce is very rich, so the asparagus was the perfect compliment. The only thing I would change would be to cut the sauce ingredients in half. It only takes a small amount for each filet, so it was a shame to throw out what wasn't used.
I hit it out of the park with this celebratory meal. I tweeked the Gorgonzola sauce by adding a bit of Asiago with the Parmesan and it was a delicious.
Amazing! Added slightly more cheese. Other than that, no changes. Delicious!
I rate this one of my favorite top 10 recipes!! I could drink the sauce! oh so good :) Thank you so much for sharing! Everyone at the dinner table agreed!
Delicious! My husband loved this!
